title: Non reporting errors for redundant space between "typeof" and "(" - related to "space-unary-ops" rule.

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

body:
**Tell us about your environment**

* **ESLint Version:** v4.16.0
* **Node Version:** v6.10.2
* **npm Version:** v5.6.0

**What parser (default, Babel-ESLint, etc.) are you using?**
Default

**Please show your full configuration:**
<details>
<summary>Configuration</summary>

<!-- Paste your configuration below: -->
```json
{
    "extends": "airbnb-base",
    "rules": {
        "prefer-arrow-callback": "off",
        "func-names": ["error", "never"],
        "space-before-function-paren": ["error", "never"],
        "indent": ["error", 4],
        "no-var": "off",
        "object-shorthand": ["error", "never"],
        "prefer-destructuring": "off",
        "import/no-unresolved": [2, {"commonjs": true}],
        "import/no-dynamic-require": "warn",
        "global-require": "warn",
        "vars-on-top": "off",
        "no-param-reassign": "off",
        "eqeqeq": "off",
        "no-use-before-define": ["error", {"functions": false}],
        "prefer-template": "off",
        "no-shadow": "off",
        "max-len": "off",
        "comma-dangle": ["error", "never"],
        "no-restricted-syntax": ["error", "BinaryExpression[operator='in']"],
        "no-continue": "off",
        "no-plusplus": "off",
        "brace-style": ["error", "stroustrup", {"allowSingleLine": false}],
        "space-unary-ops": [2, {
            "overrides": {
                "typeof": false
            }
        }]
    }
}
```
> Last config is critical
</details>

**What did you do? Please include the actual source code causing the issue, as well as the command that you used to run ESLint.**

<!-- Paste the source code below: -->
```js
var obj = null;
if (typeof (obj) === 'object') {
    console.log("THIS SHOULD REPORT ERROR BETWEEN 'typeof' AND '('. BUT IT DOESN'T");
}
if (typeof(obj) === 'object') {
    console.log('THIS IS OK AS IT DOES NOT REPORT ERROR.');
}
```

<!-- Paste the command you used to run ESLint: -->
```bash
./node_modules/.bin/eslint issue.js
```

**What did you expect to happen?**
First case with `typeof (obj) === 'object'` should report error.

**What actually happened? Please include the actual, raw output from ESLint.**
No error was reported in first case. Actually there is nothing to show from console.
